docs.lead_paragraph: The bill's opponents cited the opinion of the American Medical Association, which argues that other drugs could serve as well. They ignored the contrary views of other health-care groups like the American Nurses Association, whose members have the hour-to-hour responsibility of keeping chronic pain at bay, and the Canadian Medical Association, which prefers to give individual physicians maximum discretion in relieving pain.

headline.main: Some Remedy for Pain: A Deaf Ear Heroin, says the House of Representatives, may not be used to relieve the intractable pain of dying cancer patients. By a vote of 355 to 55, the House has buried a bill to allow physicians in hospitals and hospices to prescribe the drug as a last resort.
